transcript:
Prince Bagration bowed his head in sign of as- sent and approval. He rode off at a walk to the right and sent an adjutant to the dragoons with orders to attack the French. But this ad- jutant returned half an hour later with the news that the commander of the dragoons had already retreated beyond the dip in the ground, as a heavy fire had been opened on him and he was losing men uselessly, and so had hastened to throw some sharpshooters into the wood. 
"Very good!" said Bagrati6n. 
As he
